examples.description: Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2012-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2012-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following expenses: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> Then the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 should have exact values -> And the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE002 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE003 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE004 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE007 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE008 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE001 gross value changes to £1,200 -> Then the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries
examples.full_description: Sales Tax Updates - 4 year deferral (for Expenses using Invoice Accounting) Standard example invoice accounting Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2012-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2012-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following expenses: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> Then the VAT return covering 2019-12-31 should have exact values -> And the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE002 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE003 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE004 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE007 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE008 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE001 gross value changes to £1,200 -> Then the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries

examples.description: Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2012-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2012-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following expenses: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> And the VAT return covering 2015-03-31 has been unfiled -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-03-31 should have exact values -> And the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE002 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE003 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE004 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 gross value changes to £1,200 -> Then the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE007 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE008 should have ledger entries -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2015-12-31 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2016-03-01 should have exact values
examples.full_description: Sales Tax Updates - 4 year deferral (for Expenses using Invoice Accounting) Standard example invoice accounting, unfiling and viewing 2015-03-31 VAT return Given a UK Limited Company which was started on 2012-01-01 -> And it starts using FreeAgent on 2012-01-01 -> And the company's first accounting year ends on 2012-12-31 -> And the company is VAT registered from 2012-01-01 -> And the company has a pre-registration period of 0 months -> And the company is Cash accounting for VAT, not on the FRS -> And the VAT return covering 2019-09-30 has been filed -> And the company has the following expenses: -> Given the current date is 2019-12-02 -> And the VAT return covering 2015-03-31 has been unfiled -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-03-31 should have exact values -> And the expense EXPENSE001 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE002 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE003 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE004 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE005 gross value changes to £1,200 -> Then the expense EXPENSE005 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE007 should have ledger entries -> And the expense EXPENSE008 should have ledger entries -> Then the VAT return covering 2015-06-30 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2015-09-30 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2015-12-31 should have exact values -> And the VAT return covering 2016-03-01 should have exact values
